medical_history.chief_complaint: Fatigue, night sweats, weight loss, headache, diffuse abdominal pain, and skin lesions.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 24 months prior with a dry, nonproductive cough, progressing to persistent cough, decreased appetite, and moderate abdominal pain over the following months. Fatigue and myalgias developed, followed by painless skin lesions. Key changes included a significant weight loss (from 122.5 kg to 87.5 kg over 5 months), alongside the worsening of symptoms such as headaches and abdominal pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, anemia, chronic left-knee pain post-injury, hysterectomy, and trigger-finger release.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had diabetes mellitus and hypertension, father had colon cancer at age 70, and a daughter had systemic lupus erythematosus; other family members reported as healthy.
medical_history.social_history: From the Caribbean, living in New England, worked in a health-related field, drinks alcohol sparingly, does not smoke or use illicit drugs.
